meanings.definition: An act or means of sealing off a place to prevent goods or people from entering or leaving.
meanings.sent1: During the war, the blockade stopped any ships from coming or going.
meanings.sent2: The blockade around the castle made it difficult for anyone to get in or out.
meanings.sent3: The blockade at the store entrance made the customers do a funny dance to get around.
meanings.sent4: Her fear of failure acted as a mental blockade, preventing her from taking risks.
meanings.sent5: The blockade of ice cream in the freezer tempted her every time she opened the door.

meanings.definition: A barrier that prevents movement or access.
meanings.sent1: The fallen tree served as a blockade on the hiking trail.
meanings.sent2: The blockade of chairs in front of the door made it hard to enter the room.
meanings.sent3: The blockade of toys on the floor turned the room into a fun obstacle course.
meanings.sent4: His shyness acted as a social blockade, keeping him from making new friends.
meanings.sent5: The blockade of clouds hid the sun, casting a shadow over the field.

meanings.sent1: She tried to blockade the door with a chair to keep her brother out.
meanings.sent2: The fallen tree blockade hindered their progress along the path.
meanings.sent3: The cat blockade in the hallway made it impossible to pass without a scratch.
meanings.sent4: His anxiety blockade prevented him from speaking up in class.
meanings.sent5: The emotional blockade in her heart made it hard for her to trust again.
